oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Union Hill Baptist Church, 2002 January
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of Union Hill Baptist Church located at 1301 Union Hill Road in Goodlettsville, Tennessee. This church's congregation was founded in 1859 as a mission and became a church just a few years later. The original church building's foundation is made of rough cut stone blocks. The exterior walls are rough cut stone blocks. The roof is gabled with tar shingles. The windows are slightly arched stained glass. The doors are wood. A two-story brick addition has been built onto the rear of the original church. Forms part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. Sacred Sites Survey Project. 1 photograph : col. ; 4 x 6 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Union Hill Baptist Church (Goodlettsville, Tenn.)
